content:
185
(1) An inventory shall include all the movable and immovable property in the possession of the deceased at the time of his or her death.
(2) An inventory shall also include the property that belonged to the deceased but is in the possession of another party, with a note stating where the property is and on what basis, as well as the property that the deceased possessed but which it is claimed does not belong to him or her.
(3) The deceased's claims and debts, especially any unpaid taxes, shall be entered in the inventory of property.
